alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 09 at 1:31PM EDT until September 09 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL OCEAN AND EAST CENTRAL BURLINGTON COUNTIES... At 131 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Old Halfway, or 15 miles southwest of Toms River, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Beachwood, Holiday City-Berkeley, Bamber Lake, Cedar Glen Lakes, Whiting, Brookville, Holiday City South, Warren Grove, Pine Ridge At Crestwood, Old Halfway, Penn State Forest, South Toms River, Silver Ridge, Crestwood Village, Ocean Acres, Holiday City and Holiday Heights. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 77 and 81. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
